title: Welcome To My Blog

This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: John Robin Inston
text: I am a PhD student in the department of statistics and applied probability at UC Santa Barbara. My research interests lie in the intersection of financial mathematics, probability theory and environmental statistics.

title: About Me
text: I am a mathematician and statistician with a love of finance and environmental science. I am also passionate about enabling access to education and sharing knowledge with hopes to help empower any aspiring data scientists or graduate students when pursuing their career and learning goals.

title: Resume
text: Third year PhD student in the Department of Statistics and Applied Probability at the University of California Santa Barbara. Graduate of Lancaster University with a MSc in Quantitative Finance and a BSc in Mathematics with Statistics.

title: Resume
text: Third year PhD student in the Department of Statistics and Applied Probability at the University of California Santa Barbara. Graduate of Lancaster University with a MSc in Quantitative Finance and a BSc in Mathematics with Statistics.

title: Resume
text:
Research Interests
My research interests are orientated broadly towards financial mathematics, environmental science and computational statistics with a specific focus on the stochastic management of energy markets and natural resources. Currently, I am conducting research into the multi-period stochastic mangement of California ground water resources under the supervision of Dr Michael Ludkovski.

title: Resume
text:
Education


2022 - Present
UC Santa Barbara

PhD Statistics and Applied Probability
Topics Studied: (1) Probability Theory, (2) Statistical Theory, (3) Machine Learning, (4) Energy Finance, (5) Financial Models, (6) Advanced Time Series Methods, (7) Advanced Statistical Methods, (8) Bayesian Analysis, (9) High-Frequency Trading (10) Blockastics.




2020 - 2021
Lancaster University

MSc Quantitative Finance
Supervisors: Dr George Wang (Lancaster University), Professor Ian D’Souza (NYU Stern)
Dissertation Title: Measuring and Forecasting Mutual Fund Survival Capacity using Machine Learning Algorithms.


You can download a pdf copy of my resume here.
